website_summaries.verdict: A bike trailer is a safe and affordable way to add a second rider without the need for a tandem model. The WeeRide can be challenging to assemble, but the end results are positive.
pros: Solid connection between main bike and trailer
Great way to introduce kids to cycling
cons: Frame is relatively heavy for only a "half bike."
Not sized for very young riders, some modifications needed

customer_reviews.title: This product is potentially dangerous for some bike tires. ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is potentially dangerous for some bike tires. It has already punched into my rear tire twice, and I have just had it for less than a month. The extended hole that houses the kids handle bars point directly to the top of the rear tire of the adult bike. Any slightly uneven spot in the road. such as speed ramps, protruding sidewalks, etc. causes the kids hitched bike to drop a little and that is enough for the little extended portion of the handle bar hole to hit the rear tire of the adult bike in a very dangerous way. I am going to advocate a recall
customer_reviews.author: Kobi

customer_reviews.title: Not sure who could use this
customer_reviews.text: This is very very heavy, even without someone on it. It was difficult to attach to the bike, and made the ride VERY wobbly and scary. My six year old is light enough to just barely pull him, but its so wobbly I fear for his bones. My 9 year old can help peddle more, but the weight is really more than I can pull for any reasonable distance and him peddling makes the ride terrifying. We tried putting training wheels on it to make it more stable, but overall its easier just to wait for my youngest to be able to keep up with us in a year or two than kill ourselves with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Thieme

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Family Bike Rides
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter when she transitioned out of the baby seat on my bike. She still has her bike with training wheels but this Is great because it’s makes family Bike rides much easier and she feels like a big girl because she is riding without training wheels. I’m at ease knowing she is attached to me so we can keep up with her older siblings. Easy to attach to my bike and still easy to ride my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality leads to dangerous leaning
customer_reviews.text: Our co-pilot bike trailer leans heavily/dangerously to one side and there’s no ability to adjust, making the ride for the passenger (our daughter) scary. Unfortunately, we bought this early and are just getting to use it now. Extremely disappointed with build quality as for this trailer bike to line up properly, it needs to be aligned when welded at the factory. This thing is probably at least 20 degrees off! As well the clamp scratched up my black anodized seat post. Good concept, poor execution and build quality. I’d look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: sojourner75

customer_reviews.title: Four years and three kids in
customer_reviews.text: I have ABUSED this thing for over four years, my two sons gave ridden it, and become independent bike riders. My five year old daughter rides it now. I have been known to bike my boys to school (one biking independently the other on the copilot), then throw the bike on the copilot and lock it with the chain. The flag has fallen off, I removed the fender TODAY because it was rattling around. Other than that, scratches and some duct tape on the seat. Quality piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: CHECK ALL OF THE PARTS WHEN YOUR PRODUCT ARRIVES
customer_reviews.text: I ORDERED THIS FOR MY GRANDSON FOR CHRISTMAS. WE DIDN'T RUSH PUTTING IT TOGETHER SO BY THE TIME WE DID IT WAS MID FEBRUARY - WAY PAST 30 DAYS TO RETURN. WELL, THE SEAT HAS A BIG PUNCTURED AREA THAT WAS MOST LIKELY CAUSED DURING PACKING SINCE THE BOX WAS NOT TORN, ETC... THE PUNCTURED AREA IS GETTING BIGGER AND WE WILL SOON HAVE TO REPLACE THE SEAT DUE TO SAFETY CONCERN. BUT - IT WAS FAIRLY EASY TO ASSEMBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Baggs

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy it. Unsafe with unbelievable defects.
customer_reviews.text: After hours trying to assemble, we decided opening the second box. (Yes, we bought two of them). Incredibly, we realized that it came with an unacceptable kind of defect. The second item seems to be ok. I haven't tried to assemble it yet. This is for kids. Safety first! This company is not qualified to manufacture kids products. My wife and why (before finding out the problem) were debating if this is how it came for safety purposes. See, if we didn't have the second box to open, we could have decided for putting our kid at risk. This company has Zero quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Tiago Passos

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I needed a solution for family bike rides. My older kid with boundless energy vs my young child who is too slow to keep up, but is too old for baby seat/trailer and also wants to participate.......this is a great solution! For the first time we were able to have a great bike ride. My 4 year old did not tire out and even if he had, he could take a break while I did the pedalling. It was easy to put together for someone with basic skills in putting things together. Easy to maneuver turns and very stable. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hdane

customer_reviews.title: Functions, but with an annoying design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this product served its purpose for my family's vacation which involved bike riding. Unfortunately, there is a major design flaw in that every time the primary (parent's) bicycle makes a turn, the attached component does not easily pivot, which causes the primary bicycle's seat to spin left and right with each turn. I have fiddled with lubricating the joints, and loosening the clasp, to no avail. Functionally, you can still pull your child around, but I would classify this as a significant nuisance since your seat will continuously rotate throughout your bike ride. As a result, I don't see myself getting much use out of this and would not recommend anyone making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: Ify product
customer_reviews.text: If your kid is 6-8 don't get it especially if the kid is heavy set or moves around a lot if your kid wiggles a lot back there you'll lose control and that's a safety issue .. You could on a street with cars and you could lose control and it could upsetting when you just want to ride and not worry about falling I'd get an actual trailer not this its not something I'd trust on the road
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Love this trailer!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our trailer! So much so, that we bought a second one for our younger child. Both kids, ages 6 and 4, feel at ease and steady while on this. The ability for us to ride long distances with our family made these instantly worth it. The trailer is really easy to assemble, hook up and take off. While it's a little heavy, it's still very manageable. If the rider on the trailer is jerking around, you feel it quite a bit in the front, so that takes a little getting used to. My kids love that they can give me a "power boost" and help out with the ride. Truly one of our favorite family purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Lady D

customer_reviews.title: When you want to go on a serious bike ride, but your kid is too young ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this. She just turned 7, and she’s too small to fit a bike with gears. Rode the 11.6 mile Mineral Belt Trail in Leadville, CO. This loop has a tiresome climb to 10,606 feet, followed by a brisk downhill through the trees. It would have been impossible to do this if she rode her own bike. As it was, she had an amazing experience and wasn’t totally exhausted afterward. I haven’t had the problems that others stated. It’s heavy, but still pulls way easier than our old kid trailer, and it’s much more mature feeling for a big kid.
customer_reviews.author: G. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Works great- child loves going on bike rides and helping mommy pedal!
customer_reviews.text: Directions to assemble were just ok. Its not all that hard to assemble but the directions could be better. This trailer is fairly heavy to pull with a child on it (my child is 4 and 42 inches tall, 44lbs) - I just think of the extra calories I am burning! Also it does help when the child pedals but mine prefers to be chauffeured. I recommend making sure the bracket that attaches it to the adult bike is screwed on very tight. Otherwise it can twist the seat on the adult bike when taking corners or turning around.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Open box was just as good as new.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased "used" original box damaged to save $20. I'm a gambler. Arrived with a tear on the box as expected. Bike inside was fine. Still wrapped in original manufacturers packaging. Beautiful bright green. My petite 5 year old fit on there fine. He couldn't get the hang of the pedals and kept banging his shins on them. So I might need to get some pedal straps next. Gave me a workout biking with him behind. We did fine biking on the sidewalk and maneuvering between power poles and fences. My son said it was the best thing ever. Parents at the park were impressed with it. Easy to detach and store away.
customer_reviews.author: A Rose

customer_reviews.title: Probably not safe
customer_reviews.text: We have the swiveling problem that others have. It doesn't matter how much you tighten the seat of the main bike, when you take a turn, the whole seat turns and will not straighten back up unless you get off the bike and do it manually and re tighten the seat. Some people don't seem to have this problem so maybe some of them are defective due to bad quality control. We had the in step version of this and it worked great. This doesn't seem safe. We will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: Major win!
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer is so awesome!! I have a six year old with some health issues (growth disorder/small stature, developmental coordination disorder and seizures). We bike to school and she has been upset about still riding in a “baby” bike seat. School is 2.5 miles away and we bike on a bike path that runs along the bay. This solves so many problems!!! You can get a seat attachment that has a harness (major bonus!!) Most importantly, it’s easy to attach to my bike, easy to ride and my girl is so happy! We could even attach a basket to the handlebars. She loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolez84

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it's not great
customer_reviews.text: My son loved riding the trailer and it was pretty simple to assemble. However, it is REALLY heavy and installing and removing it was extremely difficult. You install an attachment on the seatpost of the adult bike with a slot in it that the trailer slides into. However, the fit is WAY too tight and we couldn't get it in or out without a hammer...which is just going to break the thing within a few uses. Additionally, as I ride around turns, the trailer often makes my seat turn. I then have to stop, get off and rotate it back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bergen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This allows my 4 year old to ride bikes with us instead of sitting in the bike trailer. I want to give it 5 stars, but one of the screws that attach the bike plate to the adult bike was on so tight that we ended up stripping it while trying to unscrew it. We’re able to use pliers to loosen and tighten it, but it’s annoying that we have to do it. Overall, it’s a great product. It took some time to assemble, but it’s very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: S.Keen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love this bike!! My daughter is 6 years old and was struggling to learn how to ride a bike with training wheels due to the unsteadiness. She was starting to hate riding bikes! Since attaching this to my bike, she loves riding bikes now! She asks my husband or I to go on a bike ride at least once or twice a week now. I'm really hopeful this will be a good training tool to help her feel/learn weight shifting and balance and move on to her own stand alone bike this fall. I highly recommend this bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: We had an older model Schwinn, but the arm was a few inches too short to work with my new bike - so I decided to go ahead and upgrade. My daughter is 4 years old & about 41" - I put the seat and handlebars as low as possible and she can just reach them. She needs a hand getting on and off, but I think soon she'll have it figured out! She adores her pink bike, and wants to ride with me ALL THE TIME. The box arrived with a good amount of damage, but fortunately the bike was completely unharmed. Assembly was super easy, even with my 4 year old "assisting", it took about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Package it up better but great
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike but the way it was sent to us was terrible. The box was pretty beat up but the way the bike was deconstructed and packaged up made it impossible to get apart in order to put it together. Ha, does that make sense? They had the handle bars shoved into the wheel spikes and the pedals shoved into the mix also. We had to use pure muscle to get it apart which also scratched up the bike frame pretty bad. We use it daily though and I’m shocked at how much I can tell if my daughter is pedaling or not. She loves being included in our long rides!
customer_reviews.author: LKT

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of our most favorite purchases; great for a kid who's decided they are far too grown up for an uncool baby seat but in reality, are pretty far away from independent biking. This attachment has allowed us to take long rides is enjoyable for our kid. It's worth noting that this is not the most lightweight piece, especially combined with the weight of your likely-infrequently-pedalling sidekick. Good fun and has been a confidence-builder as well as good exercise.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bought for my 4yr okd
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4year old to ride with me. Its a little clunky to put together, but you figure it out. Pay attention to the back of the adults bike and seat. This will not work with some of the cruiser bikes with large springs under seat and rack on the back. I was worried about balancing when my son was on it. We have no issues , I dont feel unsafe or worried about tipping over at all. He can peddle and thinks he is helping me ride. You do have more weight that your pulling with the extra bike and.kid on the back. We love this ride along and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Angela Graves

customer_reviews.title: Assembly wasn't bad despite too many helpers
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't bad despite too many helpers, but this is sturdy and the kids love it. It's pretty heavy and awkward to strap to a bike rack, but we make it work. The kids ask to go on "half a bike rides," which makes me LOL. My 2 year old is definitely too small- can't reach pedals, but it's perfect for my young 4 year old, especially on the crowded boardwalk.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: A great value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is high quality and affordable. Although my 3 year old grandson is capable of riding his trek bike with training wheels quite well, i wanted something where we could get some exercise. If you ride a very small frame bike, i wonder if this would work. I am 5’8 and had to up the seat some so that when i hit bumps something would not rub on the tire.
customer_reviews.author: It's a cin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, works great, very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and easy to attach to my bike. The kids love it and it seems to be a quality product. It however is by no means light given that it is steel but it is much cheaper than the aluminium variant and for me at least that tradeoff is worth it. Once you are rolling with the wind in your hair I doubt you'll care one way or another whether you went with the cheap and heavy steel option of expensive and light aluminium version.
customer_reviews.author: jpl

customer_reviews.title: Bring your tool box
customer_reviews.text: It's made by Kent international and it shows. Dirt cheap parts, poor quality control and minimal packaging. When these were 60 bucks it was excusable but at 80+ I'm not sure it's worth it. If you get one of these and you're not wrench monkey take it to a bike shop for a tune up. I had to pull apart the bottom crank assembly and the wheel hub, both were over tightened and lacked grease. Also tuned the spokes to true up the wheel, it was cartoonishly wobbly. Take the time to make it right, your kid is gonna be on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Stang_pilot_mech

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on every bike... make sure you look. It worked on mine, but not my husbands. We also had a bit of an issue of it rotating around the seat bar. It works pretty great though. My son was on the verge of a two-wheeler, but hadn't quite mastered it for our big family camping trip. I rode with my son on this and it's actually nice that he helps you pedal! Some straight/level areas, he'd do all the pedaling! We previously used a bike trailer, but this is WAY easier! I think it also helped by son get the idea of balancing better on a bike. He ended up riding his bike sans training wheels shortly after!
customer_reviews.author: Audge3

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how there are so many good reviews, but all 3 of the ones we ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is crooked. When attached to my bike or my husbands the child rides at about a 20-30 degree angle to the right. This also causes the WeeRide bike to not be inline with the pulling bike. We did return this item for a replacement 3 separate times just in case we got a funky one, but they were all that way. Not sure how there are so many good reviews, but all 3 of the ones we tried were not usable. We did inform Amazon about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: very good bike trailer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and works well. It's heavy and takes some extra peddle power going up a hill (even with the kid helping). Obviously heavier because the metal is cheaper. But works well for casual rides around the neighborhood or on flatter paths. If you're going to do longer-distance ride (more than 20 miles) then buy a more expensive trailer --but good luck keeping your kid on it for all that time.
customer_reviews.author: roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Need a tap set and grinder
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good. Problems with mine was simple fixes. The threads on the mount for it to go onto the parents bike were a little messed up. But with a tap I was able to salvage them. Also the threads on the locking nut for the handlebars was bad and had to be tapped out. Last little problem is two triangular pieces to keep it from turning too far when you ride. I used a grinder and cut them off. If left on it will cause your seat to twist side to side when you make sharp turns. Still worth the money just little inconveniences. Would recommend just need extra tools.
customer_reviews.author: Not worth the money

customer_reviews.title: Great when Lubricate!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly a 5 star product, but I'd say more deserving of 4.5 stars? 1/2 star for coming factory dry! I mean holy ****, I could barely get the thing separated the first time and the seat post would turn under me with the tandem when riding... Once I lubricated the seat attachment bar, swivel, and bar connector, absolutly worth 5 stars. Take my daughter with me, she is 4yo 42" 35lb, and she can reach the handles and pedals well. I'd say if your kid can reach the pedals well and handles, dont spend extra for the back rest attachment. Cant stress enough to lubricate the hell out of the moving pieces and connection points.
customer_reviews.author: MD88

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was so great, until we got to riding it. My kiddo can turn the handlebars of the bike, which pivots my bike. I didn’t notice it too much while we were riding, but in the hours afterwards, I developed severe severe paraspinous muscle spasms. I am 31 and extremely active, a biker and runner, and 12 days later I am still in pain and having to take ibuprofen daily, apply heating packs, and do stretching exercises. Literally has been as if I got in a car wreck. Promising, but never ever would I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Pas LeDoux

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item to introduce a young kid to biking
customer_reviews.text: I've always biked with my son; starting from having him sit in a baby seat that was mounted on my handlebar. When he outgrew that I went with the Kazam WeeRide, and we ride to his preschool every day. Paired with a bicycle bell, he never gets bored of riding with me, and loves that he can take a break and stop pedaling when he wants. It's not heavy and maneuvers easily when towing with a standard road bike. The rear mudguard is a little flimsy and eventually broke, but customer service sent me a replacement for free even though I was out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Nice co-pilot
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike. Fits my 4 yr old fine. Her arms are a little short so I turned the handle bar neck backwards during assembly. Now the handle bars are closer to her. Easy assembly. Connects to my bike and my wife's just fine. I ordered a second attachment piece for my bike so either one of us can hitch the copilot and go. Price and quality are good. It's easier to pull compared to the bigger bike trailer we used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good, but
customer_reviews.text: I really like this as a transition from the trailer that I previously used. My only complaint is that it is a little challenging for my 4 year old to be still while she works on her balance, and I am kind of afraid she may fall off while still getting used to it. I would have loved to see some sort of strap to help keep new riders secure and in place. Overall this thing is a great idea and we are enjoying it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: amelie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase - we love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with our purchase of the WeeRide CoPilot Bike Trailer. We are able to go on a family ride together easily. We have it attached to my husbands bike because it does add quite a bit of weight (the CoPilot itself and then our 35lb daughter). Our daughter is 4 1/2 and does a great job on it. She even helps pedal which my husband says he can tell and it helps when she does :) I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking into purchasing. It helps her feel like she’s actually riding with us vs being pulled behind in an enclosed trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Ckrelly

customer_reviews.title: good in theory
customer_reviews.text: Color is as shown, and it works as expected. Only issue I have with it is that it has tabs, or prongs that keep the tandem from swinging out too far on the side, good in theory, but when I try to make a sharp, or even not so sharp turn, or try to steer the bike out of the garage, my seat will turn instead of letting the tandem swing out. I get the logic behind it, and it may just be my bike, but it is annoying for every day use. My husband filed the prongs down, so it's a little better. My 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: We bought 2. No regrets
customer_reviews.text: We love these bike trailers. One of our sons has just learned to ride a bike, the other is on the verge of learning. These are great when we want to do longer bike rides or ride through areas that are less kid friendly. Having them on our bikes behind us is better than waiting for them to stop short in front of us, or worrying about them riding into the intersection before we're ready. We have a bike trailer that they can ride inside, but this is a logical next step, as they can be a more active part of the ride, not just passengers. My 4 year old has had no problems adjusting to riding on this.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 yr old Loves this bike! It fits her perfectly. She won’t ride her own bike without training wheels but does this like a pro! I can feel when she wobbles, when she helps pedal and when she doesn’t. Truly doesn’t feel like that much weight to pull. Similar to a covered mesh trailer. A little awkward to turn it around when not riding but light enough to pick up and shift if needed. Make sure to tighten the seat bracket do it doesn’t spin. Otherwise Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: shelly hansen

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we purchased.
customer_reviews.text: My friend actually told me about this product recently and I had to buy it! I have never heard of a functioning bike you can add on to your adult bike. It was easy to assemble and attach. Just make sure to do all the adjustments throughout your test runs. My son is 41 inches and he can peddle just fine with this bike. He caught on quickly. I would suggest making wider turns for an easier turn. So far still good. I highly recommend to the people who like to bike long rides as a family because it has booster my sons confidence in riding for a while so now he can ride on his own bike without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great way for kids to enjoy a bike ride
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and attach to my bike. It appears well built. We have taken it out for 2 rides and my 5 year old loves it. I can feel her pedaling when I take a break to coast. It does add a significant amount of weight to the bike ( you are towing a child so it should be expected). With the ability to raise the seat and handlebars, we should be able to use this for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Firkin Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is three years old and although I was worried she rode this with ease. We attached it to my husbands bike, I rode my bike behind them just in case.... and well we had a great day at the park. She did so well. We put the seat all the way down and she reached the pedals fine. Would recommend for anyone trying to teach their kids how to ride/balance without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Yvel

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks of use, the rear gear wheel came loose from the hub, and the pedals will no longer turn the wheel. It seems to have been press fit on. Poor quality. I will have to buy a new rear wheel.
customer_reviews.author: MAF

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the hitch unscrewed.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this and it was pretty easy to put together until it came time to attack the hitching sleeve to my bike. Two of the bolts are misshapen​ (or stripped?) and no matter what I try, I cannot get them off so I can attach the hitch to my bike. Two of them came off just fine but the other two are hopeless. I looked into ordering a replacement piece and it will take TWO months to arrive. I needed this for a trip this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: MountainClimbingMama

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for five-year-old daughter so that we could go hit the local trail and all the kids could tag along. My daughter absolutely loves riding on it. It does make biking with a child a lot easier. Just note the obvious that adding this trailer and a kid will add weight to your bike. And when braking takes an extra few seconds. Also must make wide turns when the trailer is attached. No big deal just some sidenot and when braking takes an extra few seconds. Also must make wide turns when the trailer is attached. Not a big deal just some side notes.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonshopperDE

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grandson loves to ride this with me. Like others here, he is fairly small for his age, so I reversed the handle bars and lowered the seat all the way and he can reach the pedals and ride comfortably. The bike itself is easy to attach/unattach to my bike though if you ride with your seat all the way down, you may not have room on the seat shaft to attach this bike. It rides perfectly with my bike on my two-bike Allen hitch-mounted rack.
customer_reviews.author: Gene D.

customer_reviews.title: Its a steel bike, and it works for what it states
customer_reviews.text: It works well for what it states. But like what others have stated, it works well as long as you don't turn left or right to sharply else the seat gets torqued in one way or another. So wide turns are the name of the game. Still, the bike is a steal bike, so my son's bike add on weighs almost as much as mine. Still, until he can ride on his own and keep up, this works great. I didn't want to spend a lot on a bike that would be used for a season or two, and this works. It's good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Agull

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Here's a hack for you, use a Dremmel to cut off the little ledges that prevent you from turning to give yourself a bit more turning radius without any issues. I love having this attachment and if you use the hack, your seat wont turn when you make a <90 degree turn so much. My friend told me about that and so I bought a Dremmel and cut off about half of each side and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great bike and you should buy if available
customer_reviews.text: Great bike that has allowed my 7 y/o and me to truck around the city. In past month alone we’ve went 150 miles. We did lose the splash guard along the way and could have used a better washer with the bolt but I won’t ding it a star. Makes it easier for my son and me to take longer rides. Also great for those who struggle to pick up getting the hang of the bike. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye engineer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs one of these! We took ours to a National Park (yosemite) so we wouldnt have to deal with traffic...our 7 year old is wise enough to follow daddy on her own bike, but our 5 year old is still a bit of a loose cannon. So we put her on this and it was amazing! And I could definitely tell when she was helping to peddle (although its wasn't too hard to peddle for us both when she wanted a break). We took a few hills together too. Easy to install. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Igoe

customer_reviews.title: Padding would help
customer_reviews.text: The bike is just fine, but when we got the bike it was scratched up and folded into a position that it was incredibly difficult to get it out of. Also, the light deflector was broken. This clearly was roughly handled in shipping, but so far my kid loves it. I'm incredibly annoyed that the deflector didn't have more padding so it wouldn't break, and that the bike has a bunch of chipped paint on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: So glad she did
customer_reviews.text: I had almost been talked into buying a really expensive tag-a-long at the bike store when my friend told me about this. So glad she did... It is easy to put together and works great. It's sturdy and not too heavy. My (small) seven year old rides it because she can't keep up on long bike rides, but we're planning to eventually use it for my four year old. He tried it out, but I was a little nervous he would let go and fall off. I think he would be fine with practice, but for now he'll be in his trailer. Highly recommend though, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: nslwa

customer_reviews.title: Both my youngest enjoy this. Just be prepared to feel and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my youngest enjoy this. Just be prepared to feel and have to adjust more when your child is not balancing well in the back. Though more comfortable that lugging a wide bike trailer, with the trailer I did not feel the added need for more balancing. (I have a special needs child that is not quite ready to ride on their own.) I was just disappointed that their were scratches in the finish before assembly despite the overwhelming amount of plastic wrapped or thin cardboard covering and (zip tied securely in place) most of the bike trailer or I may have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: momof4

customer_reviews.title: Good robust bike trailer attachment
customer_reviews.text: Only drawback in my opinion is this bike trailer weight. It is on a bit heavy side due to metal frame and other components. On the upside you are not likely to use this for a long period of time as your toddler/kid will graduate to own bike. Easy to attach and fold when not in use. Assembly is pretty straightforward. Packaging and packing definitely do their job. My box came pretty banged up by the carrier, but everything inside was in untouched shape.
customer_reviews.author: David Z.

customer_reviews.title: The attachment twists my seat when I go around sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: The attachment twists my seat when I go around sharp turns, even with the neck joints as lose as they'll go. The child's pedaling does nothing to help unless they pedal REALLY fast, so the slightest up-grade (I have no gears) is really challenging. Have to teach child to not attempt to steer as this pulls on the bike and can pull us into traffic or the ditch. This is indispensable to me as I have no car. I use it multiple times at least five days a week. It has held up one semester so far.
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious

customer_reviews.title: THIS is GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter and I to use because she is 7 and just won't let the training wheels go. I want to be able to go biking with her and she just can't keep up. This attached very quickly and easily to my bike and we were off and riding in no time. She didn't have any problems helping me peddle and I didn't have any trouble pulling her along when she didn't want to help. It wasn't heavy like some of those bike trailers that are used to pull little ones in. It was a very smooth ride. I would highly recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: AlexAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have been enjoying this product since day one. We have had zero reliability issues with it, and that includes taking it with us on car vacations strapped to the roof of the car. There are many miles on ours already and, if he weren't about to fully graduate to riding his own bike, I'm confident there would be many more!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this thing is so fun... my five year old just can not get the hang of a bike herself so I looked into tandem bikes. I found this in the process. It’s absolutely perfect for her, she uses the peddles and holds the handle and laughs the whole way! It’s a real workout for me, though, but that’s not a bad thing. It’s really fun for her and I both.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: She had a smaller bike with training wheels that we had been working with her on but she hated it so I bought this with my fingers crossed ...
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old 41" tall daughter loves this! She had a smaller bike with training wheels that we had been working with her on but she hated it so I bought this with my fingers crossed as I really enjoy riding my bike. I think a child and shorter would have trouble fitting. The assembly was very easy I thought. I have not put on the mud guard though as the weather has been really nice for us so I'm not sure how that works.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son couldn’t really keep up on a bike ride with his bike with training wheels. He loves going on bike rides now. I hope it will help him learn to balance better. He is 6 and very tall for his age. The seat and handlebars adjust for the kids size. He can help me pedal which is great when I get tired. I was able to attach it and assemble by myself but used my own tools instead of what was in the box. Pleased with my purchase, wish I bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: hyperhippiechic

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little bike addition. My family loves to go on bike rides but our youngest is a little slow on her own bike, but with this she can keep up. This is also boosting her confidence in learning how to ride her own two wheel bike, helping her realize that speed can be fun not scary. The bike is very sturdy and durable. It is very easy to detach from the adult bike to have room to store it or to load it in the car. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H.

customer_reviews.title: We love this Co-Pilot
customer_reviews.text: This add on for our bike has got to be the best invention yet for including your child in outdoor fun and enxercise. We love it and my daughter has become much more confident in riding her bike with this attachment. We can go on 8 mile rides and my 4 yr old daughter can take a break without us all having too. It's very easy to put together and fold down. We bought extra hitches so when one of us gets tired of riding we trade bikes and take turns. The actual attachment is heavy and does require more strength but it's still so much fun. A great product all around!!! 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Herman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for kids. We have taken our three year old out several times on bike trails, he loves it. If your child is small, i recommend mounting the handlebar stem in reverse so the handlebars are closer to the seat. Also pick up pedal extenders and BMX padding for the bars. Per other comments, I will be grinding the stops on the stem mount that restrict the turning radius of the trailer bike, although this hasn't been an issue yet with two short rides, I see this being an issue with tight turns in the future. Overall I recommend this to any family who loves biking and the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't even put into words how much we love this little bike. That sounds dramatic, but we are a biking family and this gave our oldest such independence from age 4-5. Now she is ready for her own bike next summer but our middle child will transition into this nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great tandem! Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing bike option. Our 5 year old is in heaven! And we were able to go on a long bike ride as a family. Zero issues with turns or going up or off curbs. 1 would 100% recommend it if your kid is just learning how to ride and doesn't feel quite confident, or if you just want to be able to go on long bike rides as a family.
customer_reviews.author: Stephie

customer_reviews.title: Great bike attachment
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves riding this bike attachment. He says he's providing turbo speed for our ride. I had to remove the seat reflector and drop the seat for him to comfortably reach the pedals. It's sturdy and easy to fold for transport. It would be nice if it would lock in the folded position but using a bungee with hooks works well enough.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike attachment
customer_reviews.text: Great for our 3.5 year old who is not ready to keep up with the grownups on his own bike. I flipped the handlebars over so they are low enough, and took the rear reflector off so the seat could go lower. Works great and my son loves this. We have taken him on a few 5 and 8 mile rides with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for those family bike rides
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our 3 year old. It works great and makes bike rides go a little faster (and lets us go for longer rides). We attach it to my husbands bike. It is easy to get on and off which is a big plus. It does not have a way to keep the kid in place (like if they let go) but our son is old enough it hasn’t been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N

customer_reviews.title: Overall: a lot of fun, but a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like this bike trailer. My son and I have had a lot of fun rides with it. It was pretty easy to assemble, and its been pretty sturdy so far. Its also pretty easy to attach and detach from the bike. The only complaint is with its maneuverability. For the most part, its fine, but it does not like to make sharp turns. The hinge on the bike to trailer connection does not angle enough for sharp turns. Perhaps this is a safety feature? The result is that it will often turn my bike's seat post to an angle when I am making a sharp turn with the trailer attached.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We love it. MY daughter is almost 4 years old about 40 inches tall. She could not reach the pedals. So I had to modify it a little bit. See the picture. Also it is a good idea to remove, as many reviewers have posted, those bump stops which cause the seat post to twist! Anyone needs to know how to modify it, just let me know and I will send the list of parts ( all for about $10-$20).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good, but poor tire quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great fun and good value.. just don't take too sharp turns with it. otherwise your saddle will get twisted. 1 year later - updated review - dropping a star.. after using it perhaps 2 dozen times over the course of the summer (a few miles each time on sidewalk/paved trail), the tire cracked/split down the middle and is un-usable (not related to usage).. the trailer we got had a really low quality fairly thin rubber tire.. so I'm having to replace now, that's 30-40$ to get the local bike shop to do the work or 20+$ DIY.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Very handy if you want to ride with a 5 or 6 year old.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great way to take a small child around. They get to peddle and pretend they are riding, and I don't have to worry about him going everywhere except where we are trying to go. This is a big large though. My three year old is the size of a four year old and I had to turn the handle around to make it small enough for him. The size is more appropriate for kids who are old enough to not need this. Otherwise, I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Great trail behind bike option! With modification.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of heavy if kid isn't pedaling. Took advice of others and ground off the turn stoppers, doesn't turn seat with it anymore. Bought a second hitch piece so we can easily switch between bikes. 4 year old LOVES going on rides with us! Green color is very vibrant, some brand stickers already peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable, fun and knowing my granddaughter is safe and under my control behind my bike. A+++
customer_reviews.text: It is a super great idea of having my granddaughter bike riding safely behind me. She’s too young to ride by herself and she feels like she’s riding her own bike. Very easy to attach to a regular bike and just the right length so as not to interfere with other riders on the bike trail. Great product for pre rider kids. And very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Garciacano

customer_reviews.title: We love it. I may have missed it stated somewhere ...
customer_reviews.text: I loooove this attachment! It's a little big for my 5 year old, but he's on the small side. I had it in my amazon cart for almost a year, deciding if I really wanted to spend the almost $100 on it. But then it went down to $64 and I snatched it up. We love it. I may have missed it stated somewhere in my excitement, but it does have working brakes, haha. We learned the hard way. But now we can go for much longer bike rides than what we're able to when he rides his own bike.
customer_reviews.author: kasarus

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! It is working perfectly for my 8 year old. She loves it and I can actually feel when she is pedaling. She feels like she is doing some work while we are biking, but if she gets too tired, she can just stop pedaling for a while without the rest of the family having to stop to wait for her. We have incorporated family bike nights into our weekly routine and it is wonderful. I absolutely recommend this to anyone who has a little one who desperately wants to "ride their own bike".
customer_reviews.author: Alicia R.

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: For what you pay, this is an effective co-rider for your little one. Our six year old loves it. I don’t ride off-road with the co-rider so there isn’t much worry of the handlebar post stabbing my back tire. Quality control is not great. The bolt holes on the seat-post mount are not aligned. I had to carefully match up three of the bolts; the fourth one is cross-threaded. The grip is strong enough to turn my seat if I try to U-turn in less than the width of the road. Follow another teview’s advice to put electrical tape on the seat-post mount’s teeth, that worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this bike. I bought one when my daughter was 3. She could barely reach the pedals but I liked to bike to the grocery store and this was the safest way to do it. It also taught her to ride. She was riding without training wheels before she was 4. This purchase is for a boy with mild autism. It works perfectly. He’s learning to ride. He loves its. It also fits over a mountain bike with unusually large tires.
customer_reviews.author: HLJAAEJEJH

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap and it works, but it's not very nice.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, a very good deal, but you get what you pay for. If you can afford more, but something nicer. The quality of the components is as low as possible. The hub and bottom bracket have a lot of friction, which makes it annoying to tow, adding noticeable drag. Another problem: There are a couple of safety tabs welded to the main tube (which I cut off) to prevent the bike from rotating more than 10 degrees or so to each side. When riding this doesn't matter, but it makes it basically impossible to turn this thing around without 20 ft of space.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I bought this for my 6 year old I also hook a bike trailer to the back of the Tagalog to pull the younger two kids. Works great it helps getting anextra peddler when going up the hill's. I have seen other reviews complains about the coupler being to stiff. That doesn't give me any troubles but the first time I rode it I found that the stop tabs where turning my seat on curves. So I grounded those off and now works great. I have before and after photos it took 5min. Just my 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fender doesn't fend off water
customer_reviews.text: The fender is way too short and does basically nothing, so your child will have to wear a rain jacket or tolerate getting their back wet when riding through puddles, etc. It also is a bit heavy and could use a water bottle mount, but the low price makes these latter issues a non-issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sven O Brailey

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this over a year ago and I use it daily with my kids. My 5-year-old rides the bike and my 3-year-old is on my back in a Toddler Tula carrier. It's amazing. My bike shop put it on for me and they had it done in 5 minutes so I'm guessing it's not hard to install. We got an extra latch for my husband's bike so the kid's bike can go on either of our bikes really easily. I like this much better than the car seat carriers or the trailers because your child is actively engaged! Plus if I stop pedaling my son can pedal hard enough to propel us forward entirely on his own!
customer_reviews.author: ADHD

customer_reviews.title: Great product, check the tire!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great bike, in fact this is the second one that I’ve ordered. The first was great! Easy to assemble, simple to attach to my bicycle, and a great ride with the family. Upon receiving my second WeeRide Co-Pilot bike trailer I ran into a problem. I unboxed the co-pilot, put it together in about ten mins, then start airing the tire up in preparation for its maiden voyage. BUT the tire had a hole in it, so it wouldn’t hold any air at all. I would have easily given this product five stars if not for this small issue. I’d love a replacement tire if possible!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Burke

customer_reviews.title: Wobbling belly dancer.
customer_reviews.text: Wobbly wheel is out of balance. If this was in store I would not have purchased it because of the absurd wobble. If it wasn't such a pain in the AR-SE, I would return it. . Also this is thing is almost as heavy as an adult bike. That is surprisingly heavy considering it's less than half a bike (no front tire, no brakes, no gears and only a small rear tire), At this price point, we can expect aluminum frame for half a bike. At least give us one good wheel that doesn't wobble like an Egyptian belly dancer. It works OK and the boy loves it, so I will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: ibmfordTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to set up and tons of fun to use. It's really helping my kid get more comfortable on a bike and makes longer rides so much better. The one downside is due to the simplicity of attaching to the seat post: sharp turns will twist your seat, making an uncomfortable ride. Overall, this is a great and simple product!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Y.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Riding!
customer_reviews.text: It's very heavy, turns like you're towing a trailer (duh), always moves my seat to an angle getting out of the garage. If I turn the other way, it realigns itself. My 5 year old has no problems. Took to it immediately. She has medium-low bike skills, never figured out her tricycle or her skut balance bike. She can't steer. So this solves that issue. This is A Lot of fun! We use it every morning to get to school 1/2 mile away. It's an awesome way to start our morning! I love it and think the price is fair. Also, we look really cool and get lots of compliments and inquiries.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Nice tag along at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tag along especially for the price. Yes, the turn radius is very small and it does turn the seat Post. I plan on cutting the little tabs off with my hacksaw ... problem solved. Easy fix and I see very little downside or risk.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy, very safe feeling
customer_reviews.text: It is a little heavier than I thought it would be, but that helps it feel so much sturdier and safer. My 5 year old loves riding on this and being able to help pedal or take breaks when needed. My only complaint is the turning radius is small, so it makes it difficult to back it out of my garage or turn around sharply without completely twisting my entire bike seat. I then have to get off my bike and realign my seat and everything.... but if you take wide turns you are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike.
customer_reviews.text: This tandem bike came in yesterday and it was fairly easy to put together. I feels heavy and solid. It rides very smooth. Easy to detach from the bike and put back on (although two sets of hands are better than one.) Update: after about a month of use the bike seems to be holding up. The only thing is that the flag fell off and we lost it. Other than that its good!
customer_reviews.author: Harry Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and assemble, took me no more than 10 minutes to put it together. It is heavy and challenged my bike skills because it is hard to pull my daughter (she is 5 and can't reach totally the full pedal cycle). However she enjoyed and it has been a good time bonding with her.
customer_reviews.author: Jose David Gamez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful way to spend family time. I bought this attachment for my 5 year old son so that we could all ride longer distances. I like that he can either pedal or not, and that he is right behind me so I don’t have to worry. I have to make wider turns and balancing is giving me a boss core workout but I’m pleased overall. I have a Schwin ladies mountain bike and putting everything together was not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: kingdiva

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This co-pilot bike was the easiest thing ever to put together. The outside of the box tells you the tools needed but ours came with tools inside. Color is BRIGHT and the make of the bike itself is very well engineered! Best part....the kid legit helps to pedal! 5 Star and a round of applause!
customer_reviews.author: Jodyanddavid

customer_reviews.title: Cool product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun bike trailer for a kid new to bike riding. My daughter loves it. We use her bike for short rides but this one for longer rides on busier roads. As others mentioned, the stop limits on the turn radius are a little overkill. It took more than the width of a two lane road to turn the bike otherwise it moves your seat off center. I ground mine off and it is good to go with no problems. One feature I would like to see is a strap of some sort to hold the hitch in place when it is folded up. I will probably wind up finding a Velcro strap for ours.
customer_reviews.author: Eicenogle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any kid with difficulty riding solo, or with a child who has special needs
customer_reviews.text: Bike came with easy installation instructions. It's a little heavy but better than being flimsy. If she stops pedaling it still moves as I pedal. My daughter is a tall skinny almost 9 year old and is on the spectrum and hasn't been able to ride without training wheels so I got this so that A. she can get a feel for balancing & build confidence, and B. so we can actually get somewhere! Now we ride to the ocean, to the parks for picnics, etc. She loves it so much that she doesn't let a day pass where we don't ride, if even for a little bit, and I'm getting a work out too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love!! My husband and I both have one of these attached to our hybrid bikes. Our kids aged 6 and 3.5 love riding with us and we love that we can take long bike rides as a family. We used these to go on a 20 mile bike ride last weekend and all had a really nice time. The great part is that the kids can do as much or as little work as they want. When they pedal hard it makes a bike difference, but when they don’t, it isn’t too bad on you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike addition
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this bike attachment. My 4 year old (tall 4) can easily touch the pedals and loves going on bike rides. The frame is sturdy, was easy to install and is pretty light weight. I love the flag and just overall how easy this bike is to use. We have been on so many bike rides already and my daughter loves being able to "contribute" to the bike ride. Best purchase I've made lately!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Chowske

customer_reviews.title: Nice way  to enjoy a ride with my son.
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my son is not ready to ride on his own but is too big for a seat on my bike. It is relatively easy to assemble. It was easy to get connected to my bike. This thing will make it significantly hard to pedal your own bike, I was surprised at how much it changed things. I am also surprised how much I feel him moving on his bike. Overall he is getting used to pedaling and balancing and is enjoying his ride. I need to figure out a way to see him, some sort of mirror so I can keep an eye on him.
customer_reviews.author: T.R. Hoefle

customer_reviews.title: Makes riding with my granddaughter a real hoot.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves to ride with me on this bike trailer; last ride I was serenaded as we rode down the road. I can feel the assist when she is pedaling and her weight "pushing" when we stop. The trailer is a bit heavy, but manageable; it hooks up to the towing bike easily if aligned properly. Her weight and the weight of the trailer make my job a bit more effortful, but only a bit. I would order this trailer again.
customer_reviews.author: Beltless in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: I can go on long bike rides with my kid!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a month ago. Great product for the price. My 5 year old loves it and always talks about how she can bike without training wheels, albeit I'm the one doing all the pedaling and balancing. It can feel a bit squirrely when she starts pedaling but it isnt't an issue as it is like pulling a trailer. Folds up for easy storage and just takes minutes to assemble. Definitely a great way to take your kid out without having them complaining about getting tired or having to slow down to wait for them when they are biking on their own. We have really expanded how far we can bike from home with this little add on.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Manalac

product_meta.title: Kazam WeeRide Co-Pilot Bike Trailer
product_meta.description: The WeeRide Co-Pilot is just the thing for a child who wants to tag along with Mommy or Daddy, but doesn't have the legs for it. Your child can pedal to help you along, or just coast and enjoy the scenery. Either way it's fun for both of you. Sturdy construction - just like a regular 20-inch bicycle with regular handlebars, seat, and pedals. Attaches easily and quickly to almost any bicycle with a seatpost,and folds up for storage when not in use. And it even comes with a safety flag to alert motorists. The Co-Pilot is great for the whole family, nothing says togetherness like a family bike ride.
feature_bullets: Sturdy bike trailer for teaching your child how to ride a bike
Attaches quickly and easily to almost any bike with a seat post. It is made of heavy-duty steel.
Acts just like a regular bike, with handlebars, seat, and pedals
Quick-release detachment system; safety flag and handlebar pad
Holds up to 75 pounds; weighs 24 pounds; recommended for ages 4 to 9
